title: Trump Announces 35% Tariff on Canadian Imports, Threatens More Tariffs Globally
snippets: Trump has threatened blanket levies of 15% or 20% on most trade partners, and says he will soon announce new tariffs on the EU.
Trump threatens to impose 35% tariff on goods from Canada
US president warns of imminent EU trade announcement and higher global rates for other nations
In a letter to Prime Minister Mark Carney on Thursday, President Donald Trump said the U.S. would impose a 35 per cent tariff on imports from Canada next month.

U.S. President Donald Trump threatened to impose 35 per cent tariffs on Canadian imports on Aug. 1 in a letter to Prime Minister Mark Carney posted on social media Thursday night. Trump said if Canada works to stop the flow of fentanyl into the United States he may consider a tariff adjustment. &#82
titles: Trump threatens 35% tariffs on Canadian goods

Trump threatens new 35% tariff on Canadian goods, effective Aug. 1
Trump Threatens Universal Trade Tariffs - Bloomberg
Trump threatens 35 per cent tariffs on Canada on Aug. 1
summary: President Donald Trump announced plans to impose a 35% tariff on imports from Canada beginning next month, escalating tensions between the U.S. and Canada. He also threatened to introduce blanket tariffs of 15% or 20% on most trade partners and signalled an upcoming announcement of new tariffs on the EU. The move, aimed at addressing the flow of fentanyl into the U.S., deepens the rift in the longstanding alliance between the two North American countries.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about a significant change in international trade policy, which could impact a variety of sectors and individuals. However, it doesn't go into depth about the potential impacts or solutions to the issues raised, such as the flow of fentanyl into the U.S.

title: Deaf Patient Waits Hours for Interpreter Amid Ontario Strike

title: Palestinian Activist Sues Trump Administration for $20M Over Detention
snippets: The Palestinian student activist has accused the Trump administration of smearing his name and unlawful imprisonment.

The Columbia University graduate and Palestinian activist was held for months after being arrested by immigration agents. The US government had sought to deport him over his role in campus protests over the war in Gaza.
After more than three months in detention, Mahmoud Khalil has filed an administrative complaint against the Trump administration seeking $20 million in damages.

Khalil has accused the Trump administration of smearing his name and unlawfully imprisoning him. Following his release, he has filed an administrative complaint seeking $20 million in damages against the Trump administration for his treatment and the attempt to deport him.

title: Bright Orange Guppies Linked to Higher Virility, Study Finds
snippets: Male guppies that glow with more orange aren’t just fashion-forward — they’re also significantly more sexually active. A UBC study reveals that brighter coloration is linked to virility and is genetically tied to brain development, suggesting a deeper evolutionary function. Researchers found that th
titles: Brighter, bolder, hotter: Why female guppies can't resist orange
summary: A study from UBC shows that male guppies with brighter orange coloration are more sexually active, indicating a link between color and virility. The research suggests that this trait is genetically connected to brain development, hinting at a deeper evolutionary purpose. The findings shed light on how physical characteristics may influence mating behavior in guppies.
